name: Excelsior Grand Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a large, modern hotel of a type that is now commonly found all over the world. Although it is a pretty soulless place it would still be okay if it ran like clockwork. Unfortunately it doesn’t.
reviews.title: Too Many Flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things started off promisingly enough. The greeting at reception was friendly and the checking in process was completed efficiently. However, problems began to surface as soon as we got to the room. A quick shower to freshen up revealed a fault with the drainage – a 2” layer of water quickly built up in the shower cubicle and then took 15 minutes to soak away. This was just the first of numerous faults we were to discover.
reviews.title: Outstanding location, great facilities, obliging staff - a few niggles"

reviews.text: The air con was clearly not working when the room remained baking hot an hour after the dial had been set to maximum coolness. The corridors were cool enough but smelt overpoweringly of artificial air-freshener – what were they trying to disguise? The quality of the electrics could be judged by the fact that it was possible to switch a lamp on and off simply by flexing the cable! The breeze block partitioning walls on the balconies outside the rooms had clearly moved since the hotel had been built and now had gaping holes. In fact, by the end of the stay it was apparent that the whole place was jerry-built.
reviews.title: Have stayed in better 5 star Hotels

reviews.text: Later that evening we found that the outdoor pool was closed to residents. This was to allow the area to be prepared for a wedding reception later that evening. Yes, you’ve guessed it: the noise from the disco went on into the small hours – but the room was so hot we couldn’t sleep anyway.
reviews.title: Definitively not a 5 stars

reviews.text: Breakfast the following morning was chaotic and unpleasant. It seemed that the hotel was very busy that weekend, and frankly there were far more guests than the staff could comfortably cope with. We did eventually manage to find a table but the food was hardly worth the wait. True, the various buffet bars offered a large choice, but the quality was poor – for example, the bacon and sausage looked and tasted to be steamed rather than grilled.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with outstanding view over harbour
Great Experience
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a week at the end of May and we had a fantastic time. The service could not be faulted in anyway, it was superb and the cleaniness of the facilities was of very high standard.I used the dive school in the hotel and enjoyed a 40 minute dive on HMS Maori in the harbour while my wife enjoyed a very pleasant morning in the hotels spa. The location of the hotel being but 5 minutes walk from the entrance to the citadel of Valletta is fantastic and makes it so easy to explore and enjoy the different restaurants in the evening.

I would say that this is an excellent hotel for the single traveller - it is situated in Floriana, near Valletta, and is roughly 5 minutes walk (uphill!) to the town. The hotel is close to the main bus terminus where all island buses return at end of their trips. The island is quite small and buses are efficient. I went to Mdina and Marsaxlokk by bus. The Ferry point to Sliema is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, mostly downhill. The hotel has beautiful facilities, several restaurants and a large pool. The staff are welcoming, and above all kind! You are greeted every day at breakfast on the 4th floor, with views across to Manoel Island, where small boats and cruisers sail by - idyllic! The hotel has a manmade "beach" where you can swim in the sea. There is a spa and an indoor pool which would be good for winter breaks. The hotel is also used for conferences and business - while I was there there were two charity events held, the US airforce had staff staying, and all of the MTV crew were there as the MTV music festival was on - I saw Lady Gaga, and the Blackeyed Peas for free - a bonus! A very varied and interesting place to stay. Valletta is an interesting old town. Lots of history and amazing architecture. Good resort for singles - lots to see, but not so easy for anyone with walking difficulties as Valletta is very hilly and full of steps. Shops close at 7pm. If you are a young single and looking for a bit more night life take the bus to Sliema!
reviews.title: Great hotel for the single traveller!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very modern, nice and fashion hotel. Everything is high style. Personnel freindly and eager to help. Rooms are very large and the restaurants view at the sea. A wonderful hotel for a wonderful unforgettable stay.
reviews.title: Extraordinary hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Grand Excelsior with my family (4 adults, 2 toddlers) for a 1-week vacation in Malta. We chose this hotel because we wanted to be close to the city of Valletta and have sea view at the same time; also, we liked the idea of having both a (indoor and outdoor) pool area and access to a little beach from the hotel premise We had booked 2 sea front rooms and were assigned two rooms on the second floor towards the pool area (rooms 218 and 219).
reviews.title: Not a 5-star hotel but good location

reviews.text: Pros: The hotel is located on the north-western rim of Valletta’s peninsula and lies within walking distance of Valletta’s bus hub. The view over Marsamxett harbor and to Ta-Xbiex were stunning, and this applied to our room (balcony), to the outdoor pool area, and especially to the breakfast restaurant on the 4th floor and the other two restaurants on the 5th and 6th floor. The rooms are adequately sized (although not as roomy as in other 5-star hotels). The outdoor pool was quiet, clean and featured plenty of chaise lounges and sun umbrellas. The outdoor waiters were courteous and efficient. We had enjoyed one buffet dinner in the outdoor restaurant that was superb. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide choice of food. Housekeeping did their job well and were always friendly.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Hotel - Unforgetable Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at this hotel. It is fine for what it is, but it highlights the inconsistency of 5 star ratings for hotels. IF you agree that the truly great hotels of the world like the Oriental in Bangkok or perhaps Le Bristol in Paris are 5* then quite clearly this hotel is not. It doesn’t mean it’s a bad hotel – it’s just that not everything can be the best. On that scale I’d say it is 3*.
reviews.title: Terrific location let down at times by sharp practice. Go but be aware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side the hotel has a terrific location on the water’s edge looking out to the historic buildings that surround Valetta.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, service is second to none.

reviews.text: We generally don’t eat in the hotel wherever we go and were room only here. We had breakfast one day which was OK though the salad looked like it had sweated in the sun as much as I did and I won’t expand on what the local sausage looked like.
reviews.title: Luxurious but expensive, sometimes a little pretentious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good news is that Valetta has some cracking restaurants if you hunt them out - Fusion 4 and 2-22 particularly good. If you want the night clubs of St Julian’s then don’t stay in Valetta.
reviews.title: Very good hotel though not 5-star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is huge and I doubt is often full so hunt for last minute deals. Our room (9th floor) was large, well air conditioned (vital in July Malta heat) and quiet. There are two great pools (indoor and outdoor) and a very well equipped gym. It’s recently been refurbished to varying standards.
reviews.title: Lovely, on the whole, but some issues that need addressing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed using the Spring Offer in an Executive Room with access to a small dining area on the eighth floor where we had breakfast , pre-dinner drinks and afternoon tea (not used) - the room was directly outside the MD's offices.
reviews.title: Highly recommended - make sure you use the spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had not had a massage before and the free half hour back massage was a very enjoyable experience. My wife bought two other treatments that were equally pleasant.
reviews.title: Poor Service Standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend the daily cocktail at the Harbour View - we discovered some interesting new drinks using Maltese ingredients.
reviews.title: A paradise with old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had excellent dinners dinner in the Admiral's Landing - the buffet was lavish on the Saturday night and more than adequate on Sunday. There was an excellent guitar player on the Sunday.
reviews.title: A relaxing nice experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had some hassle with a wash basin that was slow to empty and a brandy missing from the mini bar but all that was sorted out to our satisfaction.
reviews.title: a very fine luxury hotel

description: The Grand Hotel Excelsior Malta is a deluxe, 5-star resort situated within the sixteenth century fortifications of Malta’s capital city, Valletta - a UNESCO World Heritage site. The Excelsior commands the island’s premier waterfront location offering breathtaking sea views of Marsamxett Harbour and Manoel Island. As a member of Preferred Hotels & Resorts, the hotel exceeds expectations on the basis of its 5-star service excellence. All deluxe rooms and suites enjoy a harmonious blend of classic and contemporary design mixed with modern 5-star convenience including multi-channel flat screen TV. Spread over ten levels, three of which are executive floors, most of the rooms and suites overlook stunning harbour views. The Excelsior’s facilities include a private 30-berth marina, large outdoor and indoor swimming pools, health & beauty centre and 3 food and beverage outlets. The Excelsior offers versatile conference & banqueting facilities, fourteen flexible venues, a number of which have natural daylight - an ideal environment for business meetings, conferences and other events. Near to the Excelsior is the Mediterranean Conference Centre. This historical building enhances the Excelsior’s conference potential with an auditorium capacity for up to one thousand four hundred delegates. The Grand Hotel Excelsior opened its doors to its first guests on the 10th September 2007. Right from the start it was very clear that the product and service offerings were to be of a superior nature. The hotel prides itself in attracting and retaining a faithful following of leisure and business guests as well as prominent international personalities.
